a sentence or phrase from a book, speech etc which you repeat in a speech or piece of writing because it is interesting or amusing
The following quotation is taken from a nineteenth century travel diary.
a written statement of exactly how much money something will cost
Get a couple of quotations from different companies before you decide which one to use.
Ask the builder to give you a written quotation for the job.
the act of quoting something that someone else has written or said
a written statement of how much something will cost, for example some building work
Could you give us a quotation for fixing the roof?
the price of a share on a stockmarket, either its selling price or its buying price
The company processes the stock quotations from all of the nation’s major exchanges.
the day’s listing of mutual fund quotations
